Description: Part of a sheet of papyrus with the ends of three lines and, inverse to these, the start of four lines of administrative accounts texts in hieratic, written on the side of the sheet with vertical fibres uppermost. Palimpsest.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Curator's comments: Published: R.J. Demarée The Bankes Late Ramesside Papyri (British Museum Research Publication 155; London: British Museum Press 2005), 28, 62-65.

William John Bankes travelled in Egypt in 1815-1818, and is known to have collected papyri at Thebes on his second journey to Upper Egypt (1818). This papyrus was conserved by Stan Baker of the British Museum while Dr Edwards was Keeper, and is mounted in a frame sealed with blue tape of the type then used in the department.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (139361) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/139361)
